SEARCH
Package gridgames

Class FileManager

java.lang.Object
gridgames.FileManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameListener
public final class FileManager extends Object implements GameListener
Class which adds saving and loading mechanics for a Game instance.

The FileManager class is responsible of serializing relevant data belonging to a Game object, allowing the user to load an unfinished game when starting to play. It also uses serialization to save a list of high scores the user can review and clear.

The FileManager is a listener of a Game instance, and waits for specific notifications to save and load the Game instance or the high-scores list.

NOTE: This class might become aggregated or composed inside the Game class in the futur, as it currently requires the method Game.getListeners() to work, which is kind of unsafe to expose to other listeners.

See Also:
  • Game
  • Game.getListeners()

  • Method Details

    • setGame

      public void setGame(Game game)
      Sets the Game instance to read information on.

      Listeners may need to be aware of the state of a Game object to update themselves properly, e.g. if it is a graphical user interface or a terminal user interface displaying a Game.

      Specified by:
      setGame in interface GameListener
      Parameters:
      game - The Game instance to read information on.
      See Also:
      • Game

    • setController

      public void setController(GameController controller)
      Sets the GameController to interact with.

      Listeners may be the support of components the user can interact with to control a Game object, e.g. a graphical user interface using buttons. These components are provided by the GameController object.

      Specified by:
      setController in interface GameListener
      Parameters:
      controller - The GameController instance whose methods can be called to interact with the user.
      See Also:
      • GameController

    • update

      public void update(GameEvent event)
      Updates this FileManager according to a given GameEvent.
      • Saves its Game instance on EventType.NEXT_MOVE and EventType.RESET,
      • Loads a Game instance on EventType.LOAD,
      • Loads the scoreboard file on EventType.SCOREBOARD,
      • Deletes the scoreboard file on EventType.CLEAR_SCOREBOARD,
      • Deletes the Game serialization file on EventType.LOSE,
      • Deletes the Game serialization file and adds a new score to the scoreboard on EventType.WIN.
      Specified by:
      update in interface GameListener
      Parameters:
      event - Event to react on, as a GameEvent object.
      See Also:
      • GameEvent

    • addScore

      public void addScore(int score)
      Adds a score to the list of high scores and serializes it. The list of high scores is sorted to display the scores from the highest to the lowest.
      Parameters:
      score - the score to serialize, as an int.

    • deleteScoreFile

      public void deleteScoreFile()
      Deletes the .dat file containing the serialized list of high scores. Allows the user to reset the scoreboard.

      Sends messages using Game.sendText(String) depending on the outcome:

      • "Scoreboard cleared!\n" on success,
      • "No scoreboard to clear!\n" if the .dat serialization file does not exists.
